info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 8:50AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...An area of heavier snowfall over North Central MT this morning... At 850 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated a line of heavy snowfall extending from 9 miles southeast of Inverness to 20 miles west of Augusta. The line of heavy snowfall was slowly moving southeastward at 10 mph. Some locations impacted include... Great Falls, Choteau, Fort Benton, Fairfield, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Brady, The Knees, Augusta, Inverness, Black Eagle, Gildford, Fort Shaw, Power, Carter, Hingham, Floweree, Rudyard, Pishkun Reservoir and Tiber Dam. The snowfall will reduce visibility below one mile, with snowfall rates up to a half inch per hour. This band of snow is expected to move into the Great Falls area around 10 AM.
